title: Which are the different 'styles' of writing? - Quora

response.answer_text: There are basically four major styles of writing which can be further categorized into different tone and styles. The author could use : Narrative StyleDescriptive StyleAnalytical StyleArgumentative StyleThe author could use a Narrative style in which things move like a story; with a definite begining, middle and end. It is characterized by a personal touch to the description of the events.Descriptive style of writing reports the details of a person, place, thing or event. It is more like a news report you see in the front page of a daily newspaper. The writer begins in a general manner, and then offers a detailed description of the subject.Analytical style of writing, as the name suggests, involves a detailed treatment of an issue or situation. The author dives deep and tries to follow the chain of reasoning and draw inferences. The author weighs the different points of view in favour of or against his argument before arriving at any conclusionWhen the author uses the Argumentative style of writing, he always analyses the topic after taking a stand. He tries to persuade the reader using a chain of reasoning, evidence or suggestions. It is the variant of the analytical style of writing.
